thread.title: Barry Basketball Triumphs 89-69 Over Fort Lauderdale Eagles
thread.title_full: Barry Basketball Triumphs 89-69 Over Fort Lauderdale Eagles

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Barry Basketball Triumphs 89-69 Over Fort Lauderdale Eagles
text:
Barry Basketball Triumphs 89-69 Over Fort Lauderdale Eagles
The Barry Men's Basketball team dominated the University of Fort Lauderdale, winning 89-69 at home and securing their third consecutive victory. This win brought Barry's record to 3-2 and maintained a strong defensive performance, limiting opponents to an average of 67 points during this streak. The Buccaneers had a significant advantage in shooting percentages, connecting on 50% of their shots compared to UFTL's poor 10% from three-point range.
- Tarrance Warren led Barry with a game-high 19 points.
- Barry shot 50% from the field and 46% from three-point range.
- UFTL managed just 10% from beyond the arc on 9-of-38 shooting.
- 77% of Barry's baskets were assisted during the game.
Despite the victory, Barry's performance highlighted areas needing improvement, particularly the fact that they allowed a brief resurgence from UFTL in the second half before regaining control of the game.
State of Play- Barry has won three straight games and improved their overall record to 3-2.
- The team has shown strong performances, particularly in holding opponents to under 30 points in a half.
Barry is set to face Florida National at home on Saturday, November 29, with the game start time adjusted to 2:00 PM.
Bottom LineThe Buccaneers are on a positive trajectory, demonstrating improved shooting efficiency and defensive strength, capturing a critical third win and setting a promising tone for their upcoming match against Florida National.
Read more at Barry University Athletics
